result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond J DeJesus was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "E" Felony, Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond J DeJesus in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Sara D.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  6 YEARS with 5 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program, but is NOT eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 3 YEARS probation.  

Conditions of Probation/ Extended Supervision if revoked:
- 4 MONTHS condition time with good time credit and Huber for work and school.  Court objects to electronic monitoring.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution set at zero; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Letters in Support of Defense   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Sentencing Referral Form

 Court stayed commencement until 12/26/2014 at 5:00pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.

Defendant Raymond J DeJesus in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Robbery (Threat of Force) Party to a Crime, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 943.32(1)(b), 939.50(3)(e), 939.05, a Class E Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Raymond J DeJesus in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 09-25-2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Raymond J DeJesus in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For reasons stated off the record to the Court, Plea Hearing adjourned to a later date in Branch 22.  Plea Hearing scheduled for07-29-2014 at 01:30pm.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Raymond J DeJesus in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea Hearing scheduled for a later date in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-22-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial, FILED.

Defendant Raymond J DeJesus in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-24-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Raymond J DeJesus in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Raymond J DeJesus in custody.  Jacob Corr for Thomas L Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/10/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Hazel C. or ANY Radio Shack Store located within Milwaukee County.

Defendant Raymond J DeJesus in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Raymond J DeJesus in custody.  Michael C. Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
